result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven G Whitaker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
To reimburse the Door/Kewaunee Drug Task Force for the Buy money.
Maintain full-time employment and/or schooling. Obtain GED/HSED.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact with co-defendant, Samuel Paschke.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Probation can terminate after 2 years upon successful completion of all conditions of probation and with recommendation from probation agent.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent. If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

records.addlTxt: for DNA Sample

Defendant Steven G Whitaker in court with attorney Eric S Maciolek.  Defendant Steven G Whitaker in custody.  Joan M Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties for felony conviction with defendant. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make sentencing statement. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Steven G Whitaker in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek, who appears by phone.  Defendant Steven G Whitaker in custody.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 11:30 am.
from Atty Maciolek asking court to reschedule 4/09/14 hearing because of a conflict. Court reschedules.
Preliminary hearing on March 25, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 2/19/14 by jail staff. (fingerprint order destroyed 4/16/14)
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand
Defense Discovery Demand
Preliminary hearing on April 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Steven G Whitaker in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Defendant Steven G Whitaker in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Set for prelim. Bond remains as is.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only in the amount and frequency prescribed.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Steven G Whitaker in court along with attorney Eric Maciolek, who appears by phone.  Defendant Steven G Whitaker in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Atty Maciolek not sure if he'll have a conflict in representing defendant until he finds out who the CI is. Atty Maciolek asks court to set AIA for 2/24/14. Bond set.
Defendant in custody.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.
